Want to change the color of your cmd windows like shown in movies

24 Jul 2010

you guys have must have noticed the black green command prompt in every hacking movies.well you can also have the same for your computer too..here is a minor setting you need to do.

first click on cmd

fd

type color 0a ; here 0 is zero



wohoooooo :) the screen has changed ..enjoy the new geeky feel of your command prompt :)

how to install any OS in a virtual machine like oracle virtual box

24 Jul 2010

[caption id="attachment_9" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="SCREEN SHOT OF ORACLE VIRTUAL BOX"][/caption]

this is the first screen you get after opening oracle virtual box...the first thing you do is to click into new to create a new virtual machine.

.

a new window of create new machine pops out , click on it..a new window will open

[caption id="attachment_11" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="vm name and os type"][/caption]

this window will ask for the name of virtual machine and the type of os..here in my case the os is fedora which is a linux distribution.after you are done dere a new window pops out.

[caption id="attachment_12" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="ram memory allocation"][/caption]

This step is very crucial, here you allot the ram of the virtual machine you are creating , its just like the ram of your computer.you can go till the maximum line till the green is there.minimum ram should be 512mb for it to work properly.




[caption id="attachment_13" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="create new hard disk window"][/caption]

this windows lets you create a new hard disk..the minimum memory of the new VM is 10 gb. click on it and proceed.

[caption id="attachment_14" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="create new virtual hard disk wizard"][/caption]

here comes a create new virtual hard disk wizard window.click on next.

[caption id="attachment_16" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="final step"][/caption]

In this next step the hard disk storage type is being asked , you need to select dynamically expanding storage for better performance.

[caption id="attachment_15" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="hard disk storage type"][/caption]

Then click on the VM you just created to set the ISO image of the OS you want to install.

[caption id="attachment_18" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="click on the virtual machine you created just now"][/caption]

[caption id="attachment_19" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="the first run wizard"][/caption]

Select the ISO image by clicking on the folder icon. And then click on the add button on the top left of the window to select the ISO image of  OS

[caption id="attachment_20" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="choose the iso image of the OS"]
[/caption]


finally click on the next button to finish the job to creating a VM or VIRTUAL MACHINE.

[caption id="attachment_24" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="the last step of creating a virtual machine"][/caption]

now click on the VM and you are ready to go and enjoy the new OS you just now installed.

[caption id="attachment_25" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="click on the newly created VM and start working on this new OS"][/caption]

THE ORACLE VIRTUAL BOX CAN BE DOWNLOADED FROM THIS LINK  #mce_temp_url#

Any doubts regarding the post should be addressed in the comments.

How to create a usb bootable OS

24 Jul 2010

hey guys you must have been thinking of using a linux or other OS. but were scared of partitioning your hard disk or fed up of low speed live cds.

Bingo! i have a solution that solves both of these problems

we will boot our other OS from pendrive.NICE right!

here i will show you how to do it.

first you need to install a software named unetbootin-windows. you can download it from#mce_temp_url#

then you need to click on the selected file









[caption id="attachment_43" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="click on the setup of unetbootin"][/caption]

[caption id="attachment_44" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="the window of unetbootin."][/caption]

[caption id="attachment_45" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="select the OS and version for which you want to make the bootable usb."][/caption]

in the bottom select the usb drive.in my computer its G:\ drive.

[caption id="attachment_46" align="alignnone" width="614" caption="bootable usb in the making"][/caption]

when the setup is complete it will prompt you to reboot.

during reboot or when computer restarts type F12 or watever key that is assigned in your computer for entering boot menu.In boot menu go and change the boot sequence .

previously it should be like hard disk>cd-rom>usb device.........!

u need to change it to usb device>hard-disk>cd-rom......! this can be done by + or  -  sign.

when its done you are ready to go :)

restart and you have your own working portable OS .

The most important advantage its has over live cds is that it is portable and being a solid stage storage device much faster too :))

UBUNTU 10.04 OUT

30 May 2010

UBUNTU 10.04  is out....one of the best linux distros is ready to blow the mind of linux lovers and enthusiasts by its new range of three version


UBUNTU 10.04 desktop  download @ http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/download


UBUNTU 10.04 netbook download @http://www.ubuntu.com/netbook/get-ubuntu/download


UBUNTU 10.04  server    download @http://www.ubuntu.com/server/get-ubuntu/download



each of them are much better than their previos versions and they are sleek ,elegant and above all very fast.u can use them by installing them directly or virtually by virtualbox http://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads or by vmware http://www.VMware.com/Download....its easy and u can enjoy the beauty of linux without effecting your hard disk
